info.title: Paxful API
info.description:
Error List:
1001 - User provided an unknown type in the 'offer_type_field' parameter
1002 - The offer requested by hash was not found
1003 - Request payload is missing some required parameters
1004 - Error while validating input parameters. For example sending offer data to create an offer
1005 - Unknown server error
1006 - No access. For example deleting offer not belonging to you.
1007 - Trade action failed
1008 - Payment method not found
1009 - Unable to generate address, admin notified
1010 - Failed to fetch resources, try again.
1011 - Target user not found
1012 - Generate an API key first
1013 - This endpoint is forbidden for you.
1014 - Invalid JWT scope.
# Authentication For a more detailed explanation and recommendations regarding which authentication method to use in your case please refer to Paxful API authentication.

post.description: Fetch information for a current user.
Fetch all available banks for the specified country.

example.message: The limit must be between 1 and 300

post.description:
Fetch offers. Authentication is optional
        (replaces deprecated method of /buy-bitcoin?format=json, results are cached for 1 minute).
Fetch information for an offer.
Fetch information for an active/completed trade.
Fetch information for a user.

example.message: Invalid type provided for Offer Type

post.description: Return all your offers.
Fund a deferred escrow trade.
List all your currently active trades.
Mark trade as PAID.
Add username to blocked list

Deprecated. You don't need to use this endpoint directly, last seen time is going to be updated
    automatically if you use other API endpoints.
    Refresh your last seen time. This endpoint has its own rate limit and is limited to 360 requests per hour
    (every 10 second max).
Add username to the trusted user list.

Returns a list of available user types. For example - power_trader, expert_trader, etc.
     This parameter can be used as “user_type” in offer/all endpoint.
Fetch allowed cryptocurrency list. Authentication is optional.

Return a price for an offer
        (if offer happens to be in fiat currency other than USD, then it will be recalculated to it).
Start a trade.

Return bitcoin price in US Dollars. The given price is used as indicative price of bitcoin on
     the marketplace. Bitcoin price is being updated every 3 minutes. Authentication is optional.
Create an offer.
Delete an offer.
Return all prices for offers for a given payment method.

data.description: Method handling the Update of offers

post.description: Update an offer.
Cancel a trade.
Reopen trade.
Remove user from blocked list.
Remove username from the trusted list.

Fetch all marketplace supported fiat currencies and their corresponding rates in crypto and USD.
     Authentication is optional.

Give a feedback for a trade.
            NB! Message should be encoded as required per RFC 3986 (i.e. spaces should look like %20).
Fetch all feedback either for a user or an offer. Latest feedback is returned first.
Turn on all your offers.
Open a dispute.

parameters.name: x-paxful-2fa
parameters.description:
If the endpoint is invoked with an access key which has been received using Sign in with
    Paxful authorization flow and it happens that a user has 2FA enabled then you need to provide a code that you have
    received from a user using this header.
    The flow may look like this: you invoke trade/release endpoint, if you receive 1006 response code, that means user
    has 2FA enabled, in this case in your application you prompt a user to provide you with a code.
    Once you have received it, you issue trade/release once again and provide the code in this header.

post.description: Release crypto for a trade.

Fetch all marketplace supported fiat currencies and their rates in USD and BTC.
     Authentication is optional. Deprecated, use currency/list instead.
Reply to feedback.
Fetch all available tags that can be associated with offers.
Activate an offer.
Turn off all your offers.
Fetch messages for a trade.
Get user affiliate info
Fetch an user balance.
Convert from one crypto currency to another.
Post message to a trade chat.
Add proof of payments to trade. Method is to be used only for trades with 'Bank Transfer' payment method.
Fetch a list of your completed trades, optionally limited by partner username.

Fetch information for seller and buyer locations in a trade.
    Restricted: User requesting the information must be a trade partner.
Show bank account.
Deactivate an offer.

200.description: Binary of an image with given image_hash.

post.description: Fetch an image attachment from a trade.
Fetch a list of your transactions, optionally filtered by type.
Fetch all available bank accounts.

data.description: Fetch messages for all active trade

post.description:
Fetch latest messages for all active trades, or for one trade if trade_hash filter is specified.
     Latest messages are messages posted in last 10 minutes.
Fetch a list of your blocked users.

Fetch all marketplace supported fiat currencies and their corresponding rates in crypto and USD.
    Authentication is required.

Fetch a list of your Kiosk affiliate transactions. Two types of transactions returned:
    commissions you have earned when people trade through your Kiosk,
    transfers between affiliate wallet and main wallet.
Fetch user's notifications, ordered by creation date (latest at the top).

Updates an offer margin or fixed price value.
        Which field to use depends on offer type if it is a fixed price or uses a margin.
Fetch average positive margin for payment methods over last 3 and 10 days. Authentication is optional.

example.message: Unable to generate address, admin notified
Operation is unsupported for crypto currency

post.description: Generate a new wallet address (currently only BTC is supported).
Create bank account.
Delete bank account.
Update bank account.
Fetch a list of available payment methods. Authentication is optional.
Attach image to a trade chat.
Fetch a list of available dispute reasons.
Fetch list of your addresses.
Use bank account to the trade. Method is to be used only for trades with 'Bank Transfer' payment method.
Mark all unread notifications as read.

Upload image to a trade chat.
     This endpoint can be used only with OAuth 2.0 authentiction method.
Get the current conversion quotes for supported crypto currency pairs.
Fetch a list of available payment method groups. Authentication is optional.
Fetch the number of unread notifications.

started_at.description: Time when the trade was started in daytime format, e.g. '2021-07-07 14:34:25'.

total_attachments.description: Number of attachments in the trade chat.

fiat_currency_code.description: 3 letter ISO code for fiat currency, e.g. USD.

crypto_currency_code.description: Code of the crypto currency, e.g. BTC.

active.description: If TRUE then offer is going to be available for trading.

margin.description: A percent that determines differences between market price and the price of the offer.

city_name.description: For some specific payment methods (gold, cash in person), offer owner should add his location, where he is able to conduct business.

last_seen.description: How much time ago the offer owner has been seen last time, e.g seen-long-ago.

created_at.description: Timestamp of when the offer has been created.

crypto_max.description: A maximum value of the trade limit, i.e the largest amount of crypto currency that a trade can be started with.

crypto_min.description: A minimum value of the trade limit, i.e the smallest amount of crypto currency that a trade can be started with.

duty_hours.description: An array of intervals when the offer is active for the week.

is_blocked.description: Will return TRUE if this offer belongs to a user that you have blocked.

updated_at.description: Timestamp of when the offer has been updated.

location_id.description:
Location ID is needed to search for offers with specific payment methods, e.g. Cash in Person, Gold.
You can find location IDs here: https://www.geonames.org/.

offer_terms.description: Terms of the offer for a trade partner.

country_name.description: Country name of the offer owner.

release_time.description:
For SELL offer type, this will be calculated average time of the difference in minutes between buyer presses PAID and seller released coins.
For BUY offer type, this will be calcuated average time of the difference in minutes between trade started and seller released coins.
This value will become available after at least 3 trades have been conducted using an offer.

bank_accounts.description: List of bank accounts for the offer.

currency_code.description: Deprecated. Use 'fiat_currency_code' instead. 3 letter ISO code for fiat currency, e.g 'USD'.

fee_percentage.description: Commission that is charged by Paxful to conduct trades with this offer.

is_fixed_price.description: Will be 'true' if it's a fixed price offer.

payment_window.description: How much time the trade partner has to make the payment and click 'Paid' before the trade is automatically canceled.

predefined_amount.description: Deprecated. Comma-separated predefined amounts of fiat currency, i.e. 20,30,50 will be displayed as '{20,30,50}'.

fiat_currency_code.description: 3 letter ISO code for fiat currency, e.g 'USD'.

fiat_price_per_btc.description: Deprecated. Use 'fiat_price_per_crypto' and 'crypto_currency_code'. Fiat price of the offer per BTC.

last_seen_timestamp.description: A timestamp when the owner of the offer was last seen.

payment_method_name.description: A name of the payment method.

payment_method_slug.description: A slug of the payment method.

release_time_median.description:
For SELL offer type, this will be calculated median time of the difference in minutes between buyer presses PAID and seller released coins.
For BUY offer type, this will be calcuated median time of the difference in minutes between trade started and seller released coins.
This value will become available after at least 3 trades have been conducted using an offer.

require_verified_id.description: Will be TRUE if offer requires a trade partner to have verified their ID.

offer_owner_username.description: A username of the offer owner.

payment_method_label.description: A bank name, that appears after the payment method.

fiat_amount_range_max.description: A maximum value of the trade limit, i.e the largest amount of fiat currency that a trade can be started with.

fiat_amount_range_min.description: A minimum value of the trade limit, i.e the smallest amount of fiat currency that a trade can be started with.

fiat_price_per_crypto.description: Fiat price of the offer per crypto.

message.description: If 'exact_message' is used for 'type', then this field must be provided. When a fiat transfer is made this is something you expect to have provided in description of the transfer.

bank_reference_message.description: Describes what reference message you expect a trade partner to provide.

block_anonymizer_users.description: Will be TRUE if a trade partner with connected VPN will be blocked.

fiat_USD_price_per_btc.description: Deprecated. Use 'fiat_usd_price_per_crypto'. Fiat USD price of the offer per crypto.

require_verified_email.description: Will be TRUE if a trade partner is required to have their email verified.

require_verified_phone.description: Will be TRUE if a trade partner is required to have their phone verified.

show_only_trusted_user.description: Will be TRUE if the offer will be shown only to users from the trusted list.

country_limitation_list.description:
Type of limitation countries.
If 'allowed' is used then the offer will be visible ONLY for visitors from countries specified in the 'country_limitation_list'.
If 'disallowed' is used then this offer will NOT be visible for visitors from countries specified in the 'country_limitation_list'.

country_limitation_type.description: Comma-separated list of 'ISO Alpha 2' country codes.

offer_owner_country_iso.description: ISO country code of the offer owner.

require_min_past_trades.description: The offer can be shown only to users with a given amount of past trades.

new_buyer_max_fiat_limit.description: What is the max amount of fiat a new user can start a trade with for this offer.

offer_owner_profile_link.description: A link to the profile of the offer owner.

fiat_usd_price_per_crypto.description: Fiat USD price of the offer per crypto.

payment_method_country_name.description: If the payment method is country-specific, the most relevant country associated with this payment method will be returned.

offer_owner_feedback_negative.description: A number of the negative feedback of the offer owner.

offer_owner_feedback_positive.description: A number of the positive feedback of the offer owner.

require_offer_currency_match_buyer_count.description: Will be TRUE if an offer currency should match buyer's country currency.

margin.description: A percent that determines differences between market price and the price of the offer.

paid_at.description: Returns a time when the buyer markes trade as 'Paid' in daytime format, e.g. '2021-07-07 14:34:25'.

reopened.description: If TRUE then trade was reopened.

flow_type.description:
Deprecated, use 'flow_type_slug' instead.
Possible values: null (default classic), 1 (lite), 2 (gift card automated).

source_id.description:
Deprecated, use 'source_slug' instead.
Code of a source where trade has been started. Possible values: 1 (basic trade), 2 (kiosk widget).

started_at.description: Time when the trade was started in daytime format, e.g. '2021-07-07 14:34:25'.

offer_terms.description: Terms of the offer for a trade partner.

source_slug.description: Slug of a source where trade has been started. Possible values: main (basic trade), freeway (kiosk widget).

cancelled_at.description: Time when the trade was cancelled in daytime format, e.g. '2021-07-07 14:34:25'.

completed_at.description: Time when the trade was completed in daytime format, e.g. '2021-07-07 14:34:25'.

trade_status.description: Returns a status of the trade, e.g. Paid, Released.

to.description: Bank account to which money will be transferred.

from.description: Bank account from which money will be transferred.

bank_accounts.description: Bank accounts that will be used for a given trade.

flow_type_slug.description: Trade flow type. Possible values: default, lite, gcc (gift card automated).

payment_window.description: How much time the trade partner has to make the payment and click 'Paid' before the trade is automatically canceled.

instant_funding.description: If TRUE then funds successfully have been escrowed.

dispute_ended_at.description: Time when the dispute has ended in daytime format, e.g. '2021-07-07 14:34:25'.

escrow_funded_at.description: Time when the funds have been escrowed in daytime format, e.g. '2021-07-07 14:34:25'.

fee_crypto_amount.description: Total fee of the offer in Satoshi. If offer happens to be in crypto other than BTC, then fee is going to be recalculated in Satoshi.

total_attachments.description: Number of attachments in the trade chat.

dispute_started_at.description: Time when the dispute has been started in daytime format, e.g. '2021-07-07 14:34:25'.

fiat_currency_code.description: 3 letter ISO code for fiat currency, e.g. USD.

fiat_price_per_btc.description:
Deprecated. Use 'fiat_price_per_crypto' and 'crypto_currency_code'.
Fiat price of the offer per BTC (taken from the offer page).

funding_started_at.description: Time when a deferred escrow has started.

owner_responded_at.description: Time when an owner of the offer opened chat for the first time for the current trade.

crypto_amount_total.description: Total trading amount including fee in satoshi.

payment_method_name.description: A name of the payment method.

payment_method_slug.description: A slug of the payment method.

crypto_currency_code.description: Code of the crypto currency. For example BTC.

funding_completed_at.description: Time when a deferred escrow has completed.

fiat_amount_requested.description: Total trading amount including fee in fiat.

fiat_price_per_crypto.description: Fiat price of the offer per crypto.

buyer_fee_crypto_amount.description: Buyer's fee in crypto currency. For BTC trade in Satoshi, for ETH trade in GWEI, for USDT trade in micro cents, e.g. 1 usdt = 1000000 micro cents.

crypto_amount_requested.description: Trading amount after payment of fee in crypto currency. For BTC trade in Satoshi, for ETH trade in GWEI, for USDT trade in micro cents, e.g. 1 usdt = 1000000 micro cents.

crypto_current_rate_usd.description: Rate of crypto in USD of this trade.

external_crypto_address.description: External crypto address. Only for Kiosk widget.

buyer_account_created_at.description: Date of creation of buyer's Paxful account in daytime format, e.g. '2021-07-07 14:34:25'.

seller_fee_crypto_amount.description: Seller's fee in crypto currency. For BTC trade in Satoshi, for ETH trade in GWEI, for USDT trade in micro cents, e.g. 1 usdt = 1000000 micro cents.

seller_account_created_at.description: Date of creation of seller's Paxful account in daytime format, e.g. '2021-07-07 14:34:25'.

time.description: Time when transaction has been made.

type.description: Localized type name of the transaction, e.g. 'Escrow release'.

tx_id.description: Deprecated field. Please refer to transaction_id.

sent_to.description: Wallet address where crypto has been sent to.

user_note.description:
User note from transaction history.
Being on marketplace (https://paxful.com/account/transactions) a user is able to leave notes to certain transactions. If such were left, then they will be returned in this field.

sent_to_user.description: Recipient username (in case of internal transactions, i.e. between two Paxful users).

amount_crypto.description: Crypto amount of transaction. For BTC in Satoshi, for ETH in GWEI, for USDT in micro cents, e.g. 1 USDT = 1000000 micro cents.

amount_crypto_full.description: Crypto amount of transaction in BTC, USDT, ETH. A decimal number. For a value in 'cents' see 'amount_crypto'.

fiat_currency_code.description: 3 letter ISO code for fiat currency, e.g. USD.

new_crypto_balance.description: Balance after transaction in cryptocurrency. For BTC in Satoshi, for ETH in GWEI, for USDT in micro cents, e.g. 1 USDT = 1000000 micro cents.

received_from_user.description: Sender username (in case of internal transactions, i.e. between two Paxful users).

crypto_currency_code.description: 3 letter ISO code for cryptocurrency, e.g. BTC.

crypto_add_to_balance.description: Balance changes. For BTC in Satoshi, for ETH in GWEI, for USDT in micro cents, e.g. 1 USDT = 1000000 micro cents.

code.description: 3 letter ISO code for fiat currency, e.g. USD.

name.description: Name of the fiat currency, e.g. 'US Dollar'.

btc.description: Exchange rate of one BTC to the given fiat currency.

eth.description: Exchange rate of one ETH to the given fiat currency.

usd.description: Exchange rate of one USD to the given fiat currency.

usdt.description: Exchange rate of one USDT to the given fiat currency.

name_localized.description: Localized currency name (depends on the 'locale' parameter value).

author_uuid.description: A unique identifier of a feedback author.

receiver_uuid.description: A unique identifier of a feedback reciever.

uid.description: A unique identifier of a user. User can change his/her username once after registration, hence if you need a reliable identifier of a user that will never be changed then use this parameter.

joined.description: Time when a user joined, e.g. '3 months ago'.

is_vendor.description: If TRUE, then the user is a vendor (https://paxful.com/vendors).

last_seen.description: Time when a user has been seen last time, e.g. 'Seen 2 hours ago'.

total_btc.description: Deprecated. Please use 'total_crypto_traded' field. Approximate amount of total traded BTC, e.g. 'Less than 1'.

avatar_url.description: Full URL of a user avatar image.

blocked_by.description: How many users blocked the current user.

trusted_by.description: How many users have added a current user to the trusted list.

is_verified.description: If TRUE, then the current user's ID is verified.

email_verified.description: If TRUE, then the current user's email is verified.

phone_verified.description: If TRUE, then the current user's phone is verified.

btc.description: Approximate amount of total traded BTC, e.g. 'Less than 10'.

eth.description: Approximate amount of total traded ETH, e.g. 'Less than 10K'.

usdt.description: Approximate amount of total traded USDT, e.g. 'Less than 10K'.

total_crypto_traded.description: Approximate amount of total crypto traded.

code.description: 3 letter ISO code for fiat currency, e.g. USD.

name.description: Name of the fiat currency, e.g. 'US Dollar'.

rate_BTC.description: Market rate of BTC to fiat currency in Satoshi.

status.description: Will have value 'success' if the request is successful, otherwise - 'error'.

timestamp.description: Timestamp when request has been received and acknowledged by the server.

active.description: If TRUE then offer is going to be available for trading.

margin.description: A percent that determines differences between market price and the price of the offer.

city_name.description: For some specific payment methods (gold, cash in person), offer owner should add his location, where he is able to conduct business.

last_seen.description: How much time ago the offer owner has been seen last time, e.g seen-long-ago.

crypto_max.description: A maximum value of the trade limit, i.e the largest amount of crypto currency that a trade can be started with.

crypto_min.description: A minimum value of the trade limit, i.e the smallest amount of crypto currency that a trade can be started with.

duty_hours.description: An array of intervals when the offer is active for the week.

is_blocked.description: Will return TRUE if this offer belongs to a user that you have blocked.

seller_fee.description: Deprecated. Fee percentage of the offer.

is_featured.description:
If this field is TRUE, then a given offer matches 'user_country' filter (or user's automatically detected country if filter is omitted).
If this field is FALSE, it means that we were not able to find a perfect match against 'user_country' and instead return a next best thing that user might be interested in.

location_id.description:
Location ID is needed to search for offers with specific payment methods, e.g. Cash in Person, Gold.
You can find location IDs here: https://www.geonames.org/.

offer_terms.description: Terms of the offer for a trade partner.

country_name.description: Country name of the offer owner.

currency_code.description: Deprecated. Use 'fiat_currency_code' instead. 3 letter ISO code for fiat currency, e.g 'USD'.

fee_percentage.description: Commission that is charged by Paxful to conduct trades with this offer.

payment_window.description: How much time the trade partner has to make the payment and click "Paid" before the trade is automatically canceled.

fiat_currency_code.description: 3 letter ISO code for fiat currency, e.g 'USD'.

fiat_price_per_btc.description: Deprecated. Use 'fiat_price_per_crypto' and 'crypto_currency_code'. Fiat price of the offer per BTC.

last_seen_timestamp.description: A timestamp when the owner of the offer was last seen.

payment_method_name.description: A name of the payment method.

payment_method_slug.description: A slug of the payment method.

require_verified_id.description: Will be TRUE if offer requires a trade partner to have verified their ID.

offer_owner_username.description: A username of the offer owner.

payment_method_label.description: A bank name, that appears after the payment method.

fiat_amount_range_max.description: A maximum value of the trade limit, i.e the largest amount of fiat currency that a trade can be started with.

fiat_amount_range_min.description: A minimum value of the trade limit, i.e the smallest amount of fiat currency that a trade can be started with.

fiat_price_per_crypto.description: Fiat price of the offer per crypto.

fiat_USD_price_per_btc.description: Deprecated. Use 'fiat_usd_price_per_crypto'. Fiat USD price of the offer per crypto.

require_verified_email.description: Will be TRUE if a trade partner is required to have their email verified.

require_verified_phone.description: Will be TRUE if a trade partner is required to have their phone verified.

offer_owner_country_iso.description: ISO country code of the offer owner.

require_min_past_trades.description: The offer can be shown only to users with a given amount of past trades.

offer_owner_profile_link.description: A link to the profile of the offer owner.

fiat_usd_price_per_crypto.description: Fiat USD price of the offer per crypto.

offer_owner_feedback_negative.description: A number of the negative feedback of the offer owner.

offer_owner_feedback_positive.description: A number of the positive feedback of the offer owner.

day.description: A day of the week. Possible values: 1 - Monday, 2 - Tuesday, 3 - Wednesday, 4 - Thursday, 5 - Friday, 6 - Saturday, 7 - Sunday.

end_time.description: Time until the offer is active, e.g 22:15.

start_time.description: Time from the offer is active, e.g 19:30.

ended_at.description: Time when the trade has been ended (cancelled or completed) in daytime format, e.g. '2021-07-07 14:34:25'.

started_at.description: Time when the trade has been started in daytime format, e.g. '2021-07-07 14:34:25'.

completed_at.description: Time when the trade has been completed in daytime format,  e.g. '2021-07-07 14:34:25'.

fiat_currency_code.description: 3 letter ISO code for fiat currency. For example USD.

payment_method_name.description: A name of the payment method.

crypto_currency_code.description: Code of the crypto currency, e.g. BTC.

fiat_amount_requested.description: Total trading amount including fee in fiat.

crypto_amount_requested.description: Trading amount after payment of fee in crypto currency. For BTC trade in Satoshi, for ETH trade in GWEI, for USDT trade in micro cents, e.g. 1 usdt = 1000000 micro cents.

uid.description: A unique identifier of a user. User can change his/her username once after registration, hence if you need a reliable identifier of a user that will never be changed then use this parameter.

joined.description: Time when a user joined, e.g. '3 months ago'.

is_vendor.description: If TRUE, then the user is a vendor (https://paxful.com/vendors).

last_seen.description: Time when a user has been seen last time, e.g. 'Seen 2 hours ago'.

total_btc.description: Deprecated. Please use 'total_crypto_traded' field. Approximate amount of total traded BTC, e.g. 'Less than 1'.

blocked_by.description: How many users blocked the current user.

created_at.description: Date of account has been created.

is_trusted.description: Is the user added to your trusted list.

trusted_by.description: How many users have added a current user to the trusted list.

is_verified.description: If TRUE, then the current user's ID is verified.

blocked_count.description: Count of people the user has blocked.

email_verified.description: If TRUE, then the current user's email is verified.

phone_verified.description: If TRUE, then the current user's phone is verified.

first_trade_date.description: Date of the first completed trade in YYYY-MM-DD format.

btc.description: Approximate amount of total traded BTC, e.g. 'Less than 10'.

eth.description: Approximate amount of total traded ETH, e.g. 'Less than 10K'.

usdt.description: Approximate amount of total traded USDT, e.g. 'Less than 10K'.

total_crypto_traded.description: Approximate amount of total crypto traded.

completed_trades_with_me.description: A number of trades that you (who is using the API) completed with the given user.

slug.description: Tag slug. This value is to be used when creating or updating offers.

status.description: Will have value 'success' if the request is successful, otherwise - 'error'.

timestamp.description: Timestamp when request has been received and acknowledged by the server.

avatar_url.description: Full URL of the blocked user avatar image.

blocked_at.description: Date when a user has been blocked.

price.description: Price of an offer in USD.

currency.description: Fiat currency code of an offer.

crypto_currency.description: Crypto currency code. At the moment only recalculation in USD is supported.

type.description: Type of the message. Possible values: 'msg', 'bank-account', 'online-wallet-qr-code', 'trade_attach_uploaded'.

author.description: Username of an author of a message.

timestamp.description: Timestamp when author sent a message.

author_uuid.description: A unique identifier of an author of a message.

is_for_moderator.description: When a dispute is started, each trade partner has an option to share attachments for a moderator only. If the trade partner chooses this option and shares the attachment to a moderator only, the parameter value is TRUE. Otherwise, it's FALSE.

sent_by_moderator.description: If the message is sent by the moderator (admin), the parameter value is TRUE. Otherwise, it’s FALSE.

type.description: A security awareness type, e.g. phishing_awareness

message_type.description: A user message type, e.g. moderator_msg, obvious_link, attachment.

security_awareness.description: When a trade partner sends a message that the system considers as potentially risky, the system marks a message or attachment with a security icon or sends a security message (e.g. if a trade partner sends a third-party link).

supported_actions.description: A list of available actions for a user (buyer/seller) depending on a trade status.

link.description: Link to the page associated with the event.

message.example: You just confirmed your phone number

read_at.description: When notification was read. If notification has not been read yet, then NULL will be returned.

subtext.description: More detailed information about notification. Rarely used feature. You can see samples of how 'subtext' looks like by navigating to https://paxful.com/account/notifications?tab=inbox.

full_link.description: Full link to the page associated with the event.

timestamp.description: Timestamp of when a notification has been created.

message_type.description: Technical ID of notification type. You can use it to decide how to render a notification content depending on its type.

uncheck_count.description: If a notification of the same type has been received multiple times (a new trade chat message, for example), then no new notifications are created but instead this field's value is incremented.

code.description: 3 letter ISO code for cryptocurrency, e.g. BTC.

price.description: Price of an offer in USD.

currency.description: Type of the fiat currency. Currently only USD supported.

crypto_currency.description: Crypto currency code. At the moment only recalculation in USD is supported.

name.description: Payment method group name, always in English.

btc.description: Localized payment method group description for Sell BTC offers. Depends on value of 'locale' filter.

eth.description: Localized payment method group description for Sell ETH offers. Depends on value of 'locale' filter.

usdt.description: Localized payment method group description for Sell USDT offers. Depends on value of 'locale' filter.

btc.description: Localized payment method group description for Buy BTC offers. Depends on value of 'locale' filter.

eth.description: Localized payment method group description for Buy ETH offers. Depends on value of 'locale' filter.

usdt.description: Localized payment method group description for Buy USDT offers. Depends on value of 'locale' filter.

original.description: Payment method group description, always in English.

localized.description: Localized payment method group description. Depends on value of 'locale' filter.

name_localized.description: Localized payment method group name. Depends on value of 'locale' filter.
Localized dispute reason name based on the user's locale.

success.description: TRUE or FALSE, whether the request was successful.

currency.description: Currently only USD is supported, so this field value is always going to be USD.

success.description: Deprecated. See 'status' field. True or false, whether the offer was created.

prices.description: Prices, an array consisting of currency and price.

country_iso.description: ISO country code of the offer owner.

type.description: Will return offers of given type without applying a domain logic that 'offer_type' filter has. If you specify 'sell' then offers with this type will be returned and so on. See also offer_type filter. Either 'offer_type' or 'type' filter needs to be provided. If 'offer_type' filter is provided then this filter will be ignored. Possible values: 'buy', 'sell'.

group.description: A group of payment methods(slug). For a list of available payment method groups please refer to payment-method-group/list endpoint.

fiat_min.description: Will return offers where this value either fits into trade limits or equals to a predefined amount.

margin_max.description: Search offers with margin less than the value. Ignored when offer is of fixed price.

margin_min.description: Search offers with margin greater than the value. Ignored when offer is of fixed price.

offer_type.description: If you would like to get offers that you can use to buy crypto, then in fact you need to see offers where other vendors are selling crypto, hence you need to specify 'buy' to get 'sell' offers and vice versa. If you just would like to get offers filtered by type they have, then you can use 'type' parameter instead. Either 'offer_type' or 'type' filter needs to be provided. If this filter is provided then 'type' will be ignored.

user_types.description: Comma separated list of user types whose offers to return - i.e. power_trader, expert_trader. For a list of all available user types please refer to user/types endpoint. You can also provide “all” value, in this case offers of users of either available type will be returned.

location_id.description:
Location id is needed to search
for offers with specific payment methods, e.g. Cash in Person, Gold. If payment method is another - parameter will be ignored.
You can find location ids here: https://www.geonames.org/.
For better experience use locations ids of countries and cities.

user_country.description:
ISO country code, e.g. 'US'. Filter offers by available payment methods in the given country. Please use 'WORLDWIDE' if you want to get offers from all countries.
For authenticated user by default automatically detected country will be used. For non-authenticated user 'US' will be used. This filter corresponds to 'Offer location' filter available on marketplace.

currency_code.description: 3 letter ISO code for fiat currency. 'USD' or any other. Case insensitive.

payment_method.description: A slug of the payment method. To see a list of payment method slugs please refer to payment-method/list endpoint.

fiat_amount_max.description: Search offers with trade limit less than the value.

fiat_amount_min.description: Search offers with trade limit greater than the value.

crypto_currency_code.description: A filter by crypto currency code, default is 'btc'. For a list of current supported cryptocurrencies please refer to crypto/list endpoint.

fiat_fixed_price_max.description: Search offers with fiat price per crypto less than the value.

fiat_fixed_price_min.description: Search offers with fiat price per crypto greater than the value.

success.description: True or false, whether the request was successful.

author.description: Username of an author of an attachment.

created.description: Date of the wallet address creation, e.g. '2021-04-29T13:17:15+03:00'.

is_master.description: If true, then this wallet adress is main.

total_received.description: Crypto amount of external incoming. For BTC in Satoshi, for ETH in GWEI, for USDT in micro cents, e.g. 1 USDT = 1000000 micro cents.

crypto_currency_code.description: 3 letter ISO code for cryptocurrency, e.g. BTC.

count.description: A number of returned feedback at current page.

limit.description: A max number of feedback returned per page.

total_count.description: Total number of feedback for a given user or offer.

limit.description: Limit count of result on the page.

active.description: A filter by active/not active offers, by default all offers are displayed.

success.description: True or false, whether the request was successful.

messages.description: Array of messages with keys 'text', 'timestamp', 'type' and 'user_id' if its a reply from user.

attachments.description: Array of attachments in trade, contains either image_hash or url properties. For image_hash property check docs for endpoint trade-chat/image.

type.description: Kiosk transaction type. Possible values: 'Trade fee' (award from your kiosk trade transactions), 'Transfer to user balance' (transfer from your kiosk balance to your account balance).

balance_btc.description: Kiosk balance in BTC after this specific transaction has been made.

balance_usd.description: Kiosk balance in USD after this specific transaction has been made.

data.description: Array of rates data including rates in USD and BTC

status.description: Will have value 'success' if the request is successful, otherwise - 'error'.

timestamp.description: Timestamp when request has been received and acknowledged by the server.

bank_accounts.description: Bank accounts that will be used for a given trade.

crypto_amount.description: Trade amount in cryptocurrency. For BTC trade in Satoshi, for ETH trade in GWEI, for USDT trade in micro cents (e.g 1 usdt = 1000000 micro cents).

fiat_currency_code.description: 3 letter ISO code for fiat currency, e.g 'USD'.

balance.description: Currently available user balance in Satoshi for BTC wallet, micro cents for USDT wallet and WEI for ETH wallet.

balance_escrow.description: Balance in escrow. Currently available in Satoshi for BTC wallet, micro cents for USDT wallet and WEI for ETH wallet.

incoming_amount.description: Deposit that is currently waiting for a blockchain confirmation.

crypto_currency_code.description: Cryptocurrency code of current balance. By default - BTC.

order_id.description: Unique ID (UUID) of the conversion that has been used to convert funds.

converted_to_amount.description: Amount received after conversion in crypto. For BTC in Satoshi, for ETH in GWEI, for USDT in micro cents, e.g. 1 USDT = 1000000 micro cents.

converted_from_amount.description: Amount of crypto that has been converted. For BTC in Satoshi, for ETH in GWEI, for USDT in micro cents, e.g. 1 USDT = 1000000 micro cents.

converted_to_crypto_currency_code.description: Cryptocurrency code of received amount. For a list of current supported cryptocurrencies please refer to crypto/list endpoint.

converted_from_crypto_currency_code.description: Cryptocurrency code of the amount that has been converted. For a list of current supported cryptocurrencies please refer to crypto/list endpoint.

tags.description: Comma-separated list of tags. For a list of available tags please refer to offer-tag/list and use 'slug' parameter.

margin.description: A percent that determines differences between market price and the price of the offer.

currency.description: 3 letter ISO code of fiat currency, e.g. USD. Case insensitive.

active.description: A flag to activate offer cap.

amount.description: The maximum amount of bitcoin/fiat currency that can be traded from all trades using this offer. The offer will be automatically deactivated once the cap limit is reached.

range_max.description: A maximum value of the trade limit, i.e the largest amount of fiat that a trade can be started with. (Minimum value for the field 1).

range_min.description: A minimum value of the trade limit, i.e the smallest amount of fiat that a trade can be started with. (Minimum value for the field 1).

duty_hours.description: An array of intervals when the offer is active for the week.

fixed_price.description: Should be used only if the offer is created as a fixed price offer. If this parameter is used then 'margin' should not be specified.

location_id.description:
Location id is needed to search for offers with specific payment methods,
e.g. Cash in Person, Gold. If payment method is another - parameter will be ignored.
You can find location ids here: https://www.geonames.org/.
For better experience use locations ids of countries and cities.

offer_terms.description: Terms of the offer for a trade partner. String up to 2500 characters.

bank_accounts.description: Comma-separated list of bank account UUIDs.

trade_details.description: Instructions for a trade partner. String up to 2500 characters.

payment_method.description: A slug of the payment method. To see a list of payment method slugs please refer to payment-method/list endpoint.

payment_window.description: How much time the trade partner has to make the payment and click 'Paid' before the trade is automatically canceled. Integer between 30 to 43200.

payment_country.description: 3 letter ISO country code (e.g. USA, EST, fra, etc.). If the payment method is country-specific, specify the most relevant country associated with this payment method.

predefined_amount.description: Comma-separated predefined amounts of fiat currency, i.e. 20,30,50. If not specified, then a user can enter any amount within the offer range.

payment_method_group.description: A group of payment methods. For a list of available payment method groups please refer to payment-method-group/list endpoint.

payment_method_label.description: A bank name will appear after the payment method. Maximum 25 characters and only letters, numbers, and dash. You can write several bank names separated by space, e.g. CBS SEB METROPOLITAN ALFA.

message.description: If 'exact_message' is used for 'type', then this field must be provided. When a fiat transfer is made this is something you expect to have provided in description of the transfer.

bank_reference_message.description: Required for bank-transfer payment method with flow_type 'bt-auto'. Describes what reference message you expect a trade partner to provide.

show_only_trusted_user.description: The offer will be shown only to users from the trusted list.

country_limitation_list.description: Comma-separated list of 'ISO Alpha-2' country codes.

country_limitation_type.description: Type of limitation countries. Valid values are 'allowed' or 'disallowed'. If 'allowed' is used then the offer will be visible ONLY for visitors from countries specified in the 'country_limitation_list'. If 'disallowed' is used then this offer will NOT be visible for visitors from countries specified in the 'country_limitation_list'.

require_min_past_trades.description: The offer will be shown only to users with a given amount of past trades.

tags.description: Comma-separated list of tags. For a list of available tags please refer to offer-tag/list and use 'slug' parameter.

margin.description: A percent that determines differences between market price and the price of the offer.

currency.description: 3 letter ISO code for fiat currency. 'USD' or any other. Case insensitive.

range_max.description: A maximum value of the trade limit, i.e the largest amount of fiat that a trade can be started with. (Minimum value for the field 1).

range_min.description: A minimum value of the trade limit, i.e the smallest amount of fiat that a trade can be started with. (Minimum value for the field 1).

fixed_price.description: Should be used only if the offer is created as a fixed price offer. If this parameter is used then 'margin' should not be specified.

location_id.description:
Location id is needed to search for offers with specific payment methods,
e.g. Cash in Person, Gold. If payment method is another - parameter will be ignored.
You can find location ids here: https://www.geonames.org/.
For better experience use locations ids of countries and cities.

offer_terms.description: Terms of the offer for a trade partner. String up to 2500 characters.

bank_accounts.description: Comma-separated list of bank account UUIDs.

trade_details.description: Instructions for a trade partner. String up to 2500 characters.

is_fixed_price.description: Fixes the price of your cryptocurrency, rather than using the market price. If this field is used, then you should also specify a value for 'fixed_price'.

payment_method.description: A slug of the payment method. To see a list of payment method slugs please refer to payment-method/list endpoint.

payment_window.description: How much time the trade partner has to make the payment and click 'Paid' before the trade is automatically canceled. Integer between 30 to 43200.

crypto_currency.description: A cryptocurrency that this offer will use, a code should be specified. For example - btc, eth. If not set, then 'btc' will be used as a default.

payment_country.description: 3 letter ISO country code (e.g. USA, EST, fra, etc.). If the payment method is country-specific, specify the most relevant country associated with this payment method.

predefined_amount.description: Comma-separated predefined amounts of fiat currency, i.e. 20,30,50. If not specified, then a user can enter any amount within the offer range.

payment_method_group.description: A group of payment methods. For a list of available payment method groups please refer to payment-method-group/list endpoint.

payment_method_label.description: A bank name will appear after the payment method. Maximum 25 characters and only letters, numbers, and dash. You can write several bank names separated by space. For example: CBS SEB METROPOLITAN ALFA.

message.description: If 'exact_message' is used for 'type', then this field must be provided. When a fiat transfer is made this is something you expect to have provided in description of the transfer.

bank_reference_message.description: Required for bank-transfer payment method with flow_type 'bt-auto'. Describes what reference message you expect a trade partner to provide.

show_only_trusted_user.description: The offer will be shown only to users from the trusted list.

country_limitation_list.description: Comma-separated list of 'ISO Alpha-2' country codes.

country_limitation_type.description: Type of limitation countries. Valid values are 'allowed' or 'disallowed'. If 'allowed' is used then the offer will be visible ONLY for visitors from countries specified in the 'country_limitation_list'. If 'disallowed' is used then this offer will NOT be visible for visitors from countries specified in the 'country_limitation_list'.

require_min_past_trades.description: The offer will be shown only to users with a given amount of past trades.

payment_method.description: A slug of the payment method. To see a list of payment method slugs please refer to payment-method/list endpoint.

trade_hash.description: This parameter will only be available when working with 'trade.chat.bank_account' webhook. When invoking bank-account/get this parameter will be missing from the response.

pair.description: Pair of cryptocurrency conversion codes, e.g. 'BTCETH'.

quote_id.description: A unique quote id that should be used when performing conversion using wallet/convert.

is_active.description: Active status of the pair. Shows if conversion of the pair is possible.

expired_time.description: Time when conversion pairs will expire (UTC time). If expired, new quote_id should be requested.

page.description: A page to return, 10 feedback per page.

role.description: What kind of feedack to fetch - either from 'buyers' or 'sellers'. Possible values: 'buyer', 'seller'.

username.description:
Username of a trader who you want to fetch feedback for.
Either this filter or 'offer_hash' has to be used, if both are provided then an error will be returned.

offer_hash.description:
A hash (ID) of an offer.
Either this filter or 'username' has to be used, if both are provided then an error will be returned.

reason.description: Description of the dispute reason, max length 250 characters.

reason_type.description: Type of reason, for available reasons refer to trade/dispute-reasons endpoint.

messages.description: Array of messages with keys 'text', 'timestamp', 'type' and 'user_id' if its a reply from user.

attachments.description: Array of attachments in trade, contains either image_hash or url properties. For image_hash property check docs for endpoint trade-chat/image.

count.description: A number of transactions in the current page.

btc_rate.description: BTC exchange rate to a given fiat currency (see 'currency' filter). By default is USD.

fiat_currency.description: Fiat currency that is used to calculate fees/rates.

avg_to.description: Average positive margin of completed trades for the last 10 days.

avg_from.description: Average positive margin of completed trades for the last 3 days.

gitf-card.description: Payment method slug is the key.

files.description: Url and mimetype for the attached file as proof.

crypto_currency_code.description: Cryptocurrency code of balance. By default - BTC. For a list of current supported cryptocurrencies please refer to crypto/list endpoint.

amount.description: Amount to convert in cryptocurrency. For BTC in Satoshi, for ETH in GWEI, for USDT in micro cents, e.g. 1 USDT = 1000000 micro cents.

order_id.description:
Unique ID (UUID) of the conversion, that your application needs to generate.
Having this parameter ensures idempotency of the operation - you can invoke the endpoint as many times with the same parameter, but conversion will be executed only once.
This helps to avoid accidental double conversions.

quote_id.description: Value for this field can be fetched using wallet/conversion-quotes endpoint.

convert_to.description: Cryptocurrency to convert to. For a list of current supported cryptocurrencies please refer to crypto/list endpoint.

convert_from.description: Cryptocurrency to convert from. For a list of current supported cryptocurrencies please refer to crypto/list endpoint.

crypto_currency_code.description: Wallet cryptocurrency code. At the moment can be only BTC.

limit.description: Maximum number of notifications that can be returned per page.

total_count.description: A total number of available notifications (on all pages).

data.description: List of payment methods including their name and slug.

status.description: Will have value 'success' if the request is successful, otherwise - 'error'.

timestamp.description: Timestamp when request has been received and acknowledged by the server.

size.description: Size to fetch, either 1 (original), 2 (full sized) or 3 (thumbnail).

image_hash.description: Hash ID of an image. To get the hash id please refer to the image_hash parameter in response of the trade-chat/get endpoint.

status.description: Will have value 'success' if the request is successful, otherwise - 'error'.

timestamp.description: Timestamp when request has been received and acknowledged by the server.

trade_hash.description: Hash ID of a trade. If specified, method returns latest messages only for this trade. If omitted, the method return latest messages/attachments for all active trades.

type.description: Type of transaction. Possible values: 'trade', 'non-trade', 'received', 'received-internal', 'received-external', 'sent', 'sent-internal', 'sent-external', 'hedging', 'all'. By default is 'all'.

limit.description: A number of transactions to return. By default is 100.

crypto_currency_code.description: Filter by cryptocurrency code. Use 'all' value to get a list of transactions with all supported cryptocurrencies. Default is btc. For a list of current supported cryptocurrencies please refer to crypto/list endpoint.

margin.description: A percent that determines differences between market price and the price of the offer.

fixed_price.description: Should be used only if the offer is created as a fixed price offer. If this parameter is used then 'margin' should not be specified.

RequestBodyOfferUpdatePrice.description: Required one of margin or fixed_price

slug.description: Payment method slug. For a list of available payment method slugs please refer to payment-method/list endpoint.

currency.description: Fiat currency code, by default is USD. For a list of supported fiat currencies please refer to currency/list endpoint.

addresses.description: List of your crypto addresses, 50 limit.

country_iso.description: ISO country code of the offer owner.

additional_info.description: Additional information about bank account with country-specific data.

fiat_currency_code.description: 3 letter ISO code for fiat currency.

page.description: Requested page, by default is 1. Every page returns up to 50 notifications.

is_read.description: If FALSE then only unread notifications will be returned. If filter is not specified, then both read and unread ones will be returned.

file.description:
URL of a publicly accessible file in the Internet. Supported formats are jpeg, png, jpg. Files up to 10mb are only allowed.
When the endpoint is invoked, Paxful will download an image from the specified URL and post it to a given trade chat.
Please consider using image/upload endpoint instead as it will process uploaded image instantly.

crypto_currency_code.description: Cryptocurrency code of the wallet addresses. By default - BTC. For a list of current supported cryptocurrencies please refer to crypto/list endpoint.

quotes.description: List of current quotes. All pairs if no request fields are specified.

file.description: File to upload. Supported formats are jpeg, png, jpg. Files up to 10mb are only allowed.

convert_to.description: Cryptocurrency to convert to. For a list of current supported cryptocurrencies please refer to crypto/list endpoint.

convert_from.description: Cryptocurrency to convert from. For a list of current supported cryptocurrencies please refer to crypto/list endpoint.

scopes.profile: User profile information: sub, nickname, given_name, family_name, locale, picture
scopes.paxful:bank:list: Fetch a list of the banks
scopes.paxful:trade:get: Fetch information for an active/completed trade
scopes.paxful:user:trust: Add username to a trusted user list
scopes.paxful:user:types: Returns a list of available user types
scopes.paxful:offer:price: Return a price for an offer
scopes.paxful:offer:prices: Return all prices for offers for a given payment method
scopes.paxful:feedback:give: Give a feedback for a trade
scopes.paxful:currency:rates: List all currencies and their rates
scopes.paxful:wallet:convert: Convert from one cryptocurrency to another
scopes.paxful:trade:add-proof: Add proof of payments to trade. Method is to be used only for trades with 'Bank Transfer' payment method.
scopes.paxful:trade:completed: Fetch a list of your completed trades
scopes.paxful:trade:locations: Fetch information for seller and buyer locations in a trade
scopes.paxful:bank-account:get: Fetch information for a bank account
scopes.paxful:trade-chat:image: Fetch an image attachment from trade
scopes.paxful:transactions:all: Fetch a list of your transactions
scopes.paxful:bank-account:list: Fetch a list of the bank accounts
scopes.paxful:trade-chat:latest: Fetch latest messages for all active trades
scopes.paxful:user:blocked-list: Fetch list of your blocked users
scopes.paxful:offer:update-price: Updates an offer margin or fixed price value
scopes.paxful:payment-method:list: Fetch a list of available payment methods
scopes.paxful:trade:dispute-reasons: Fetch a list of available dispute reasons.
scopes.paxful:notifications:mark-read: Mark all unread notifications as read
scopes.paxful:wallet:conversion-quotes: Get the current conversion quotes for supported cryptocurrency pairs

OAuth2.description: To start working with OAuth 2.0 based authentication method you need to create an application in developers portal, for more details please refer to OAuth 2.0 authentication.

ApiSeal.name: apikey
ApiSeal.description: For more details how to authenticate using `apiseal` method please refer to ApiSeal authentication.
